intro: Prangos foeniculacea, commonly known as the Persian parsley or wild celery, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Prangos foeniculacea is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to its aromatic foliage.
